blocks.text: A chemical reaction is a process in which one or more substances undergo a chemical change to form new substances with different properties.
Indicators of a chemical reaction include change in colour, evolution of gas, temperature change, and formation of precipitate.

blocks.text: A chemical equation is the symbolic representation of a chemical reaction showing reactants and products using chemical formulas.

blocks.text: Chemical equations must be balanced according to the law of conservation of mass so that the number of atoms of each element is equal on both sides.

blocks.text: Chemical reactions are classified into combination, decomposition, displacement, double displacement and oxidation-reduction reactions.
In a combination reaction, two or more substances combine to form a single product.

blocks.question: Give an example of a combination reaction.

blocks.text: In decomposition reactions, a single compound breaks down into two or more simpler substances.

blocks.question: Give an example of thermal decomposition.

blocks.text: Decomposition reactions can be thermal, electrolytic, or photochemical depending on the source of energy used.
A displacement reaction occurs when a more reactive element replaces a less reactive element from its compound.

blocks.caption: Iron nail in copper sulphate solution

blocks.question: What happens when iron is placed in copper sulphate solution?

blocks.text: In double displacement reactions, ions exchange between two compounds resulting in formation of new compounds.
Oxidation involves addition of oxygen or removal of hydrogen, while reduction involves removal of oxygen or addition of hydrogen.

blocks.question: Identify oxidation and reduction in reaction: CuO + H2 → Cu + H2O
blocks.solution: CuO is reduced to Cu and H2 is oxidized to H2O.

blocks.text: Corrosion is the gradual destruction of metals due to reaction with moisture, air or chemicals. Rusting of iron is a common example.
Rancidity refers to oxidation of fats and oils resulting in unpleasant smell and taste. It can be prevented using antioxidants or airtight packaging.
